summary: Kingler
body:
Kingler

Kingler’s pinchers have the most powerful clamp of all pokemon, and even large water types like Gyarados will avoid their claws.

However, due to the large size of their claws Kingler will tire quickly and let go.

summary: My Poke-Pinions: 007-009 - The Squirtle Line
title: My Poke-Pinions: 007-009 - The Squirtle Line
body:
My Poke-Pinions: 007-009 – The Squirtle Line

Squirtle

Name: Squirtle’s name is a mixture of ‘squirt’ as in a squirt of water or a small child’s nickname, and ‘turtle’ because…..turtle. Apparently, it might also poke at squirrels because of the shape of its tail. I have never heard of that, and it kinda blew my mind.

I love the name Squirtle. It’s very bouncy, memorable, and if I ever have a pet turtle, you bet your ass I’m naming it…

View On WordPress

summary: Pokemon Teams or Matches
title: Pokemon Teams or Matches
body:
Hey, so I did these forever ago, but I wanted to see if anyone would be interested in me making a pokemon team based on a dragon’s lore/art/look? 

Not sure how much to charge for something like this, so I’ll just take tips, probably? 


Reblog this post with the dragon you want a match or a team for with a link to them or shoot me a message. 

Examples under the cut:

summary:
**Omnis Dratini Line Abilities Poll, Part 2**

Although votes were low, it was pretty much agreed on that **Marvel Scale /...
caption:
Omnis Dratini Line Abilities Poll, Part 2

Although votes were low, it was pretty much agreed on that Marvel Scale / Multiscale would be kept! Now to figure out which of these Abilities would be staying! 

Should the Omnis Dratini line…

  1. Keep Marvel Scale as an Ability
  2. Keep Multiscale as an Ability
  3. Have both Marvel Scale and Multiscale stay (NOTE: Marvel Scale becomes a Normal Ability, Multiscale stays as the Hidden Ability)

Since questions was removed, you will need to vote by commenting to this post, replying in Disqus, reblogging this post, or sending us a message.

What gets your vote?

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Silvanala Silvally and Lunala fusion Ghost/Flying Type Ability: Shadow Shield Hidden Ability: RKS Shield - When given a memory...
caption:
Silvanala

Silvally and Lunala fusion

Ghost/Flying Type

Ability: Shadow Shield

Hidden Ability: RKS Shield - When given a memory disk, it’s type doesn’t change but it gains that type’s resistances.

The Synthetic Bat Pokemon

Silvanala was created in a lab using the DNA of lunala and silvally.  It just wants to fly free but is kept in a lab for research.  Its wings are gaseous and it can ‘turn them off’ when it wants to walk on all four legs.  However, it usually keeps to flying. Its wings are razor sharp.

Request for @negamewtwo. I hope you like it. I made two sprites just because you couldn’t really see the extra detail.  But yeah.  I actually quite like this one. It’s kinda like a wyvern dragon type of thing.  I actually based it on Legna in its holy dragon form from drakengard 2 (Props to anyone who knows this series.)

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Reshiram and Zekrom
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Reshiram and Zekrom
body:
One long journey later, and we finally meet up with the two big cheeses of Black and White. Out and saying it now, these two are, to me, the strongest cover Legendary duo to date. Or at least this is when the cover Legendaries start getting really good. Which is certainly something I’m glad to say in a Generation where almost every other Legendary is really lame in one way or another. They’re both strong as dragon designs, and while they both may have shortcomings, they make up for it with their synergy as a rival pair. Pretty much my only major complaint about the two is the fact that they’re yet another pair of dragons, even after Rayquaza, Dialga, Palkia, and Giratina.

643: Reshiram

But let’s take them on the merits of them and them alone. Surprisingly enough, Reshiram is our first Dragon/Fire type. Those two things are so synonymous with each other, I’m surprised we haven’t had 15 by now. But I’m glad our first one looks like this. A big, white-hot dragon with a lot of flowing design elements. I’ve said before that I like when dragons get either fuzzy or feathery.

I love the way they stuck to their guns with the colors. Other than their eyes and the colors their tails glow when they’re “energized”, the two are entirely monochromatic. Reshram is outright beautiful looking with the white all over. Makes it look angelic, and yet, appropriately too perfect, in the Aether Foundation sort of way. Only better considering this is more or less the Pokemon of N, the story’s primary antagonist.

It also plays up the more natural looking elements of its design. Obvious are the fur and/or feathers, but it’s also got significantly less detail than its sibling Zekrom. Reshiram overall just looks more naturally formed.

And the big jet-engine torch-tail is real rad too. Like I said, the white looks amazing, but accompanying that with the flaming oranges looks S+.

Personal Score: 9/10

Suberb!

644: Zekrom

And here we have the significantly meaner looking Zekrom, the Pokemon of ideals. And also our first Dragon/Electric type. An interesting combo for sure. Zekrom is just plain badass looking. Totally unashamed and bombastic design with a boss presence topped with one mean grimace.

This bad boy is one detailed monster, but it all works to its benefit. All the seams only help the look of making it look more mechanical to go against Reshiram’s more natural look. And the crazy electric engine tail looks really badass. The all-black look is just killer too.

And I appreciate that they’ve gone all-friggin-out with the theming of these two. The entire story of Black and White revolves around a literal argument. Should Pokemon be released and freed or are they fine with humans? The two dragons are given as contrasting but similar designs as possible to communicate this. Them being opposite colors, not just black and white, but orange vs. blue. Reshiram’s more traditionally feminine features, airy design, and more natural look to go against Zekrom’s more traditionally masculine, tough, and metallic design.

Personal Score: 10/10

Damn.

Overall:

These two are just stunning as Legendaries. Again, their only downfall is that they’re both dragons. They’d be hard-pressed to be topped if they were to maybe take inspiration from elsewhere. And yeah, I know it’s all the more fitting given how they’re Dragons amongst some infighting of a kingdom’s rulers. But ah well. They’re both just killer dragons in general.

[Archive]

Reshram is outright beautiful looking with the white all over. Makes it look angelic, and yet, appropriately too perfect, in the Aether Foundation sort of way. Only better considering this is more or less the Pokemon of N, the story’s primary antagonist.

It also plays up the more natural looking elements of its design. Obvious are the fur and/or feathers, but it’s also got significantly less detail than its sibling Zekrom. Reshiram overall just looks more naturally formed.

And the big jet-engine torch-tail is real rad too. Like I said, the white looks amazing, but accompanying that with the flaming oranges looks S+.

Personal Score: 9/10

Suberb!

644: Zekrom

And here we have the significantly meaner looking Zekrom, the Pokemon of ideals. And also our first Dragon/Electric type. An interesting combo for sure. Zekrom is just plain badass looking. Totally unashamed and bombastic design with a boss presence topped with one mean grimace.

This bad boy is one detailed monster, but it all works to its benefit. All the seams only help the look of making it look more mechanical to go against Reshiram’s more natural look. And the crazy electric engine tail looks really badass. The all-black look is just killer too.

And I appreciate that they’ve gone all-friggin-out with the theming of these two. The entire story of Black and White revolves around a literal argument. Should Pokemon be released and freed or are they fine with humans? The two dragons are given as contrasting but similar designs as possible to communicate this. Them being opposite colors, not just black and white, but orange vs. blue. Reshiram’s more traditionally feminine features, airy design, and more natural look to go against Zekrom’s more traditionally masculine, tough, and metallic design.

Personal Score: 10/10

Damn.

Overall:

These two are just stunning as Legendaries. Again, their only downfall is that they’re both dragons. They’d be hard-pressed to be topped if they were to maybe take inspiration from elsewhere. And yeah, I know it’s all the more fitting given how they’re Dragons amongst some infighting of a kingdom’s rulers. But ah well. They’re both just killer dragons in general.

[Archive]

trail.content_raw:
[[MORE]]

One long journey later, and we finally meet up with the two big cheeses of Black and White. Out and saying it now, these two are, to me, the strongest cover Legendary duo to date. Or at least this is when the cover Legendaries start getting really good. Which is certainly something I’m glad to say in a Generation where almost every other Legendary is really lame in one way or another. They’re both strong as dragon designs, and while they both may have shortcomings, they make up for it with their synergy as a rival pair. Pretty much my only major complaint about the two is the fact that they’re yet another pair of dragons, even after Rayquaza, Dialga, Palkia, and Giratina.

643: Reshiram

But let’s take them on the merits of them and them alone. Surprisingly enough, Reshiram is our first Dragon/Fire type. Those two things are so synonymous with each other, I’m surprised we haven’t had 15 by now. But I’m glad our first one looks like this. A big, white-hot dragon with a lot of flowing design elements. I’ve said before that I like when dragons get either fuzzy or feathery.

I love the way they stuck to their guns with the colors. Other than their eyes and the colors their tails glow when they’re “energized”, the two are entirely monochromatic. Reshram is outright beautiful looking with the white all over. Makes it look angelic, and yet, appropriately too perfect, in the Aether Foundation sort of way. Only better considering this is more or less the Pokemon of N, the story’s primary antagonist.

It also plays up the more natural looking elements of its design. Obvious are the fur and/or feathers, but it’s also got significantly less detail than its sibling Zekrom. Reshiram overall just looks more naturally formed.

And the big jet-engine torch-tail is real rad too. Like I said, the white looks amazing, but accompanying that with the flaming oranges looks S+.

Personal Score: 9/10

Suberb!

644: Zekrom

And here we have the significantly meaner looking Zekrom, the Pokemon of ideals. And also our first Dragon/Electric type. An interesting combo for sure. Zekrom is just plain badass looking. Totally unashamed and bombastic design with a boss presence topped with one mean grimace.

This bad boy is one detailed monster, but it all works to its benefit. All the seams only help the look of making it look more mechanical to go against Reshiram’s more natural look. And the crazy electric engine tail looks really badass. The all-black look is just killer too.

And I appreciate that they’ve gone all-friggin-out with the theming of these two. The entire story of Black and White revolves around a literal argument. Should Pokemon be released and freed or are they fine with humans? The two dragons are given as contrasting but similar designs as possible to communicate this. Them being opposite colors, not just black and white, but orange vs. blue. Reshiram’s more traditionally feminine features, airy design, and more natural look to go against Zekrom’s more traditionally masculine, tough, and metallic design.

Personal Score: 10/10

Damn.

Overall:

These two are just stunning as Legendaries. Again, their only downfall is that they’re both dragons. They’d be hard-pressed to be topped if they were to maybe take inspiration from elsewhere. And yeah, I know it’s all the more fitting given how they’re Dragons amongst some infighting of a kingdom’s rulers. But ah well. They’re both just killer dragons in general.

[Archive]
